intro: Galeandra quartiniana, commonly known as the Quartinian orchid, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its elegant, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), while its inflorescence bears clusters of showy, violet or purple blossoms. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and endangered species in its native range.
